sentence.Network_en: Most of my accomplishments came as the result of sheer doggedness.
sentence.Network_cn: 我大多数的成就纯粹是坚持不懈的结果。

sentence.Network_en: But such doggedness comes at the cost of further, perhaps fatal, rebellions.
sentence.Network_cn: 布朗先生的顽固换来了更多的, 也许是致命的, 背叛.

PerfectNetExp.abs: d开头的褒义形容词（英语） - 已解决 - 搜搜问问 ... Divinity 神 Doggedness 顽强坚持不懈 Dominator, 统治者.

entry.def: If you describe someone's actions as dogged, you mean that they are determined to continue with something even if it becomes difficult or dangerous.

example.ex: They have gained respect through sheer dogged determination.
example.tran: 他们完全是凭借顽强的毅力赢得了尊敬。
他对他们权利的坚决主张

auth_sentence.content: "The Big Red One" has lost none of its doggedness.
auth_sentence.res_content: "The Big Red One" has lost none of its doggedness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "The Big Red One" has lost none of its doggedness.

auth_sentence.content: Helen's doggedness meant that she did finally give birth to Anna at home.
auth_sentence.res_content: Helen's doggedness meant that she did finally give birth to Anna at home.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Helen's doggedness meant that she did finally give birth to Anna at home.

auth_sentence.content: He has instilled the same doggedness into a generation of young journalists he has trained.
auth_sentence.res_content: He has instilled the same doggedness into a generation of young journalists he has trained.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has instilled the same doggedness into a generation of young journalists he has trained.
